column2: The union sued repeatedly for damages did not expect the settlement to be large.
column3: Did the union expect a big settlement?

column2: Anita lay on the grass and looked up at the stars.
column3: Was Anita outside?

column2: The man who was sold the orange car knew he was not getting a very good deal.
column3: Did the man like the deal he was getting?

column2: The gardener mowed the wide lawns and seeded them.
column3: Were the lawns large?

column2: The jogger inhaled deeply in an attempt to regain his breath.
column3: Was the jogger out of breath?

column2: The spy came very quietly and secretly to escape the soldiers.
column3: Did the spy make a lot of noise?

column2: The patient expected to die soon would not give up easily.
column3: Did the patient die quickly?

column2: The girl apologized to her parents for having stayed out past curfew.
column3: Was the girl caught staying out late?

column2: The trolls who were brought the dishevelled princess thought she looked good enough to eat.
column3: Did the trolls like how the princess looked?

column2: The singer practiced all day until she could hit the high notes every time.
column3: Was the singer able to hit the high notes without practicing?

column2: The academics who were taught the new technique thought the standard method might be better.
column3: Did the academics think the new technique was better?

column2: The doctor mistook the symptoms for food poisoning.
column3: Did the patient have food poisoning?

column2: The excited toddler blew out all the candles and wished for a pony.
column3: Did the toddler want a pony?

column2: The editor played the startling tape agreed the story was big.
column3: Did the editor think the story was important?

column2: The player who was passed the soccer ball failed to score a goal.
column3: Did the player score a goal?

column2: John became more frustrated with each passing minute.
column3: Did John get less frustrated over time?

column2: Patrick woke up to find himself alone in the house.
column3: Were there other people around when Patrick woke up?

column2: The strangers asked discreetly for directions pulled out a map of New England.
column3: Did the strangers have a map of New England?

column2: The babysitter ran frantically after the misbehaving children in the park.
column3: Were the children well behaved?

column2: Even though Joanna flew directly to Boston on Friday, she still missed the conference.
column3: Was Joanna able to attend the conference?

column2: The married couple arose before dawn in order to prepare for the trip.
column3: Did the couple wake up early?

column2: They drew lots to settle who should make dinner that day.
column3: Did they draw lots to decide who should make lunch?

column2: The men paid the hush money called the store immediately.
column3: Did the men call the store?

column2: The jogger accidentally crushed the flower underneath her foot.
column3: Did the jogger intend to step on the flower?

column2: The new student talked to all of her new classmates on the playground during recess.
column3: Were there some classmates the new student did not talk to?

column2: The friends studied together all day for an upcoming exam in their hardest class.
column3: Did the friends study independently?

column2: The sound of music attracted a number of guests to the cafe.
column3: Was the music coming from the cafe?

column2: The women who were served the fine caviar stumbled into the pool.
column3: Did the woman end up in the pool?

column2: The hiker was overcome by the heat and needed to rest for a few minutes.
column3: Did the hiker need a break?

column2: The new manager undid most of the good work of his predecessor.
column3: Did the previous manager do good work?

column2: The dog was confined to the living room while the vacuum was running.
column3: Was the dog confined to the bedroom?

column2: The doctors who were prescribed the ghastly medicine recovered quickly.
column3: Did the doctors stay sick?

column2: The sparkles on the celebrity's dress glittered under the harsh lighting.
column3: Did the outfit have sparkles on it?

column2: A different kind of fire arose within Andrew as he thought about the new idea.
column3: Was Andrew passionate about the idea?

column2: The hungry dog ate all of the food in the bowl.
column3: Was there any food left in the bowl?

column2: The ornate clock chimed loudly every time it struck a new hour.
column3: Was the clock working?

column2: Peter did all the dishes before putting his children to bed.
column3: Did Peter do the dishes after putting the children bed?

column2: The kindergartner bade good bye to her mother and ran to her friends.
column3: Did the kindergartner bid good bye to her father?

column2: The arrogant man added the woman's contact information to his phone.
column3: Did the man get the woman's phone number?

column2: The company awarded the large contract was anxious for the project to get started.
column3: Did the company want to get started with the project?

column2: The worker who was delivered the official letter got upset quite suddenly.
column3: Was the worker happy about the letter?

column2: The student pretended to be sick until their mother left the room.
column3: Was the student really sick?

column2: Maria went upstairs and changed into jeans and a fitted blouse.
column3: Did Maria change into a dress?

column2: The companies mailed the damaging information decided to discontinue the services immediately.
column3: Did the companies intend to discontinue the services?

column2: Foreigners unfailingly fall in love with the place.
column3: Did foreigners like the place?

column2: The woman was who told the edgy joke did not think it was funny.
column3: Did the woman like the joke?

column2: The two students exchanged notes until they were caught by the teacher.
column3: Were the students caught by the teacher?

column2: The horses raced past the barn fell in a puddle.
column3: Did the horses end up in the puddle?
